define-flag.name: source
define-flag.description: A reference to an OSCAL catalog or profile providing the referenced control or subcontrol definition.

define-flag.name: statement-id
define-flag.description: A reference to a control statement by its identifier

define-assembly.name: set-parameter
define-assembly.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

define-field.name: parameter-value
define-field.description: A parameter value or set of values.

define-field.name: system-id
define-field.description: A unique identifier for the system described by this system security plan.

define-flag.name: identifier-type
define-flag.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

allowed-values.enum: The identifier was assigned by FedRAMP.
A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as defined by RFC4122.

define-flag.name: param-id
define-flag.description: A reference to a parameter within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

define-assembly.name: system-security-plan
define-assembly.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: System Security Plan Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier for this catalog instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

define-assembly.name: import-profile
define-assembly.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: A resolvable URL reference to the profile to use as the system's control baseline.

remarks.p: The value of the href can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment that points to a back-matter resource in the same document.

If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified resource in the document's back-matter or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.

If an internet resource is used, the href value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document containing the link.

define-assembly.name: system-characteristics
define-assembly.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

define-field.name: system-name
define-field.description: The full name of the system.

define-field.name: system-name-short
define-field.description: A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of the system.

define-field.name: security-sensitivity-level
define-field.description: The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by FIPS-199.

remarks.p: Often, organizations require the security sensitivity level to correspond with the highest confidentiality, integrity, or availability level identified by security-impact-level.

allowed-values.enum: A value of 1, 2, or 3 as defined by SP 800-63-3.
A value of 1, 2, or 3 as defined by SP 800-63-3.
A value of 1, 2, or 3 as defined by SP 800-63-3.
As defined by SP 800-63-3.
As defined by SP 800-63-3.
As defined by SP 800-63-3.
The associated value is one of: public-cloud, private-cloud, community-cloud, government-only-cloud, hybrid-cloud, or other.
The associated value is one of: saas, paas, iaas, or other.
The public cloud deployment model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
The private cloud deployment model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
The community cloud deployment model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
TODO: define
Any other type of cloud deployment model that is exclusive to the other choices.

remarks.p: The hybrid cloud deployment model, as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing, can be supported by selecting two or more of the existing deployment models.

allowed-values.enum: Software as a service (SaaS) cloud service model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
Platform as a service (PaaS) cloud service model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) cloud service model as defined by The NIST Definition of Cloud Computing.
Any other type of cloud service model that is exclusive to the other choices.

remarks.p: Since responsible-party associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

allowed-values.enum: The authorizing official for this system.
The authorizing official's designated point of contact (POC) for this system.
The executive ultimately accountable for the system.
The primary management-level point of contact (POC) for the system.
The primary technical point of contact (POC) for the system.
Other point of contact (POC) for the system that is not the management or technical POC.
The primary role responsible for ensuring the organization operates the system securely.
The point of contact (POC) responsible for identifying privacy information within the system, and ensuring its protection if present.

define-assembly.name: system-information
define-assembly.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

define-assembly.name: information-type
define-assembly.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this information type entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

define-assembly.name: categorization
define-assembly.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

define-flag.name: system
define-flag.description: Specifies the information type identification system used.

allowed-values.enum: Based on the section identifiers in NIST Special Publication 800-60 Volume II Revision 1.

define-field.name: information-type-id
define-field.description: An identifier qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

define-assembly.name: confidentiality-impact
define-assembly.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the unauthorized disclosure of the described information.

define-assembly.name: integrity-impact
define-assembly.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the unauthorized modification of the described information.

define-assembly.name: availability-impact
define-assembly.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the disruption of access to or use of the described information or the information system.

allowed-values.enum: Is this a privacy sensitive system? yes or no
The system is privacy sensitive.
The system isnot privacy sensitive.
A link to the privacy impact assessment.
A 'low' sensitivity level as defined in FIPS-199.
A 'moderate' sensitivity level as defined in FIPS-199.
A 'high' sensitivity level as defined in FIPS-199.

remarks.p: FIPS-199 taxonomy is provided here as a starting point. We will provide other taxonomies based on community requests.

define-field.name: base
define-field.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

define-field.name: selected
define-field.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

define-field.name: adjustment-justification
define-field.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

define-assembly.name: security-impact-level
define-assembly.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

define-field.name: security-objective-confidentiality
define-field.description: A target-level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

define-field.name: security-objective-integrity
define-field.description: A target-level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

define-field.name: security-objective-availability
define-field.description: A target-level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

define-assembly.name: status
define-assembly.description: Describes the operational status of the system.

define-flag.name: state
define-flag.description: The current operating status.

allowed-values.enum: The system is currently operating in production.
The system is being designed, developed, or implemented
The system is undergoing a major change, development, or transition.
The system is no longer operational.
Some other state.

remarks.p: If 'other' is selected, a remark must be included to describe the current state.

define-field.name: date-authorized
define-field.description: The date the system received its authorization.

define-assembly.name: authorization-boundary
define-assembly.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

remarks.p: A visual depiction of the system's authorization boundary.

define-field.name: remarks
define-field.description: Commentary about the system's authorization boundary that enhances the diagram.

remarks.p: A given uuid must be assigned only once to a diagram.

define-assembly.name: diagram
define-assembly.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: The identifier for this diagram.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of the diagram.

remarks.p: This description is intended to be used as alternate text to support compliance with requirements from Section 508 of the United States Workforce Rehabilitation Act of 1973.

define-field.name: caption
define-field.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

define-field.name: remarks
define-field.description: Commentary about the diagram that enhances it.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to the diagram image.

remarks.p: A diagram must include a link with a rel value of "diagram", who's href references a remote URI or an internal reference within this document containing the diagram.
The internal reference "#diagram1" points to an attached resource defined in the back-matter as a resource. The media-type indicates that the image is a Portable Network Graphics (PNG) image.

define-assembly.name: network-architecture
define-assembly.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

remarks.p: A given uuid must be assigned only once to a diagram.

define-assembly.name: data-flow
define-assembly.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

remarks.p: A given uuid must be assigned only once to a diagram.

define-assembly.name: system-implementation
define-assembly.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

define-assembly.name: leveraged-authorization
define-assembly.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a common control provider.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this leveraged authorization entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

define-field.name: party-uuid
define-field.description: A reference to the party that manages the leveraged system.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to the system security plan for the leveraged authorization.

remarks.p: A set of inventory-item entries that represent the managed inventory instances of the system.

allowed-values.enum: The component allows an authenticated scan.
The component does not allow an authenticated scan.

remarks.p: A given uuid must be assigned only once to a user.

define-assembly.name: control-implementation
define-assembly.description: Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

remarks.p: Since multiple set-parameter entries can be provided, each parameter must be set only once.

Use of set-parameter in this context, sets the parameter for all related controls referenced in an implemented-requirement. If the same parameter is also set in a specific implemented-requirement, then the new value will override this value.

define-assembly.name: implemented-requirement
define-assembly.description: Describes how the system satisfies an individual control.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this control requirement entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

allowed-values.enum: Identifies the source of the implemented control.
The control is implemented by the organization owning the system, but is not specific to the system itself.
The control is implemented specifically to this system.
The control is provided by the system, but must be configured by the customer.
The control must be implemented by the customer.
This control is inherited from an underlying system.
Indicates all or some portion of this control is inherited from an underlying authorized system.
Accountable for ensuring the asset is managed in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
Responsible for administering a set of assets.
Members of the security operations center (SOC).
Members of the network operations center (NOC).
Responsible for responding to an event that could lead to loss of, or disruption to, an organization's operations, services or functions.
Responsible for providing information and support to users.
Responsible for the configuration management processes governing changes to the asset.

remarks.p: Since all implementation statements are defined at the by-component level (e.g., type=this-system), there must be at least one by-component.
Since multiple set-parameter entries can be provided, each parameter must be set only once.
Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.
Since statement entries can be referenced using the statement's statement-id, each statement must be referenced only once.

Since by-component can reference component entries using the component's uuid, each component must be referenced only once. This ensures that all implementation statements are contained in the same by-component entry.

define-assembly.name: statement
define-assembly.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

remarks.p: A reference to the specific implemented statement associated with a control.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this control statement entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

allowed-values.enum: Accountable for ensuring the asset is managed in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
Responsible for administering a set of assets.
Members of the security operations center (SOC).
Members of the network operations center (NOC).
Responsible for responding to an event that could lead to loss of, or disruption to, an organization's operations, services or functions.
Responsible for providing information and support to users.
Responsible for the configuration management processes governing changes to the asset.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

Since by-component can reference component entries using the component's uuid, each component must be referenced only once. This ensures that all implementation statements are contained in the same by-component entry.

define-assembly.name: by-component
define-assembly.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

define-flag.name: component-uuid
define-flag.description: A reference to the component that is implementing a given control or control statement.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this by-component entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

remarks.p: The implementation-status is used to qualify the status value to indicate the degree to which the control is implemented.

define-assembly.name: export
define-assembly.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

define-assembly.name: provided
define-assembly.description: Describes a capability which may be inherited by a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: responsibility
define-assembly.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this responsibility entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

remarks.p: A role defined at the by-component level takes precedence over the same role defined on the parent implemented-requirement or on the referenced component.
Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: inherited
define-assembly.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: satisfied
define-assembly.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this satisfied entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

allowed-values.enum: Accountable for ensuring the asset is managed in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.
Responsible for administering a set of assets.
Members of the security operations center (SOC).
Members of the network operations center (NOC).
Responsible for responding to an event that could lead to loss of, or disruption to, an organization's operations, services or functions.
Responsible for providing information and support to users.
Responsible for the configuration management processes governing changes to the asset.
Responsible for the creation and maintenance of a component.
Organization responsible for providing the component, if this is different from the "maintainer" (e.g., a reseller).

remarks.p: Since multiple set-parameter entries can be provided, each parameter must be set only once.

define-flag.name: provided-uuid
define-flag.description: Identifies a 'provided' assembly associated with this assembly.

define-flag.name: responsibility-uuid
define-flag.description: Identifies a 'provided' assembly associated with this assembly.

define-assembly.name: assessment-plan
define-assembly.description: An assessment plan, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment plan. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the plan changes.

remarks.p: Used by the SAP to import information about the system being assessed.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

remarks.p: Used to add any components, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any inventory-items, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any users, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Since multiple component entries can be provided, each component must have a unique uuid.
A given uuid must be assigned only once to a user.

define-assembly.name: terms-and-conditions
define-assembly.description: Used to define various terms and conditions under which an assessment, described by the plan, can be performed. Each child part defines a different type of term or condition.

allowed-values.enum: Defines the circumstances, conditions, degree, and manner in which the use of cyber-attack techniques or actions may be applied to the assessment.
Any information the assessor should make known to the system owner or authorizing official. Has child 'item' parts for each individual disclosure.
Defines any assessment activities which the system owner or authorizing official wishes to ensure are performed as part of the assessment.
Defines any assessment activities which the system owner or authorizing official explicitly prohibits from being performed as part of the assessment.
Defines conditions related to the delivery of the assessment results, such as when to deliver, how, and to whom.
Defines any supposition made by the assessor. Has child 'item' parts for each assumption.
An explanation of practices, procedures, and rules used in the course of the assessment.

define-assembly.name: import-ssp
define-assembly.description: Used by the assessment plan and POA&M to import information about the system.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: >A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

remarks.p: The value of the href can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment that points to a back-matter resource in the same document.

If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified resource in the document's back-matter or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.

If an internet resource is used, the href value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document containing the link.

define-assembly.name: local-objective
define-assembly.description: A local definition of a control objective for this assessment. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment actions.

remarks.p: The specified control-id must be a valid value within the baseline identified by the target system's SSP via the import-profile statement.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this control objective.

define-assembly.name: assessment-method
define-assembly.description: A local definition of a control objective. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment activities.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this defined assessment method. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given assessment method across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this assessment method.

define-assembly.name: activity
define-assembly.description: Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed. In the assessment plan, this is an intended activity which may be associated with an assessment task. In the assessment results, this an activity that was actually performed as part of an assessment.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment activity. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given included activity across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this included activity.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this included activity.

define-assembly.name: step
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual step in a series of steps related to an activity, such as an assessment test or examination procedure.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies a step. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this step. A UUID should be consistently used for a given test step across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this step.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this step.

remarks.p: This can be optionally used to define the set of controls and control objectives that are assessed by this step.
Identifies the roles, and optionally the parties, associated with this step that is part of an assessment activity.
Since multiple party-uuid entries can be provided, each role-id must be referenced only once.
This can be optionally used to define the set of controls and control objectives that are assessed or remediated by this activity.
Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

allowed-values.enum: The assessment method to use. This typically appears on parts with the name "assessment".
The process of holding discussions with individuals or groups of individuals within an organization to once again, facilitate assessor understanding, achieve clarification, or obtain evidence.
The process of reviewing, inspecting, observing, studying, or analyzing one or more assessment objects (i.e., specifications, mechanisms, or activities).
The process of exercising one or more assessment objects (i.e., activities or mechanisms) under specified conditions to compare actual with expected behavior.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: task
define-assembly.description: Represents a scheduled event or milestone, which may be associated with a series of assessment actions.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment task.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: The type of task.

allowed-values.enum: The task represents a planned milestone.
The task represents a specific assessment action to be performed.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this task.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this task.

define-assembly.name: timing
define-assembly.description: The timing under which the task is intended to occur.

define-assembly.name: on-date
define-assembly.description: The task is intended to occur on the specified date.

define-flag.name: date
define-flag.description: The task must occur on the specified date.

define-assembly.name: within-date-range
define-assembly.description: The task is intended to occur within the specified date range.

define-flag.name: start
define-flag.description: The task must occur on or after the specified date.

define-flag.name: end
define-flag.description: The task must occur on or before the specified date.

define-assembly.name: at-frequency
define-assembly.description: The task is intended to occur at the specified frequency.

define-flag.name: period
define-flag.description: The task must occur after the specified period has elapsed.

define-flag.name: unit
define-flag.description: The unit of time for the period.

allowed-values.enum: The period is specified in seconds.
The period is specified in minutes.
The period is specified in hours.
The period is specified in days.
The period is specified in calendar months.
The period is specified in calendar years.

define-assembly.name: dependency
define-assembly.description: Used to indicate that a task is dependent on another task.

define-flag.name: task-uuid
define-flag.description: References a unique task by UUID.

define-assembly.name: associated-activity
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual activity to be performed as part of a task.

define-flag.name: activity-uuid
define-flag.description: References an activity defined in the list of activities.

remarks.p: Identifies the person or organization responsible for performing a specific role defined by the activity.
Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.
The assessment subjects that the activity was performed against.
Identifies the person or organization responsible for performing a specific role related to the task.

define-assembly.name: reviewed-controls
define-assembly.description: Identifies the controls being assessed and their control objectives.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of control objectives.

define-assembly.name: control-selection
define-assembly.description: Identifies the controls being assessed. In the assessment plan, these are the planned controls. In the assessment results, these are the actual controls, and reflects any changes from the plan.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of in-scope controls specified for assessment.

define-assembly.name: include-all
define-assembly.description: A key word to indicate all.

remarks.p: Used to select a control for inclusion by the control's identifier. Specific control statements can be selected by their statement identifier.
Used to select a control for exclusion by the control's identifier. Specific control statements can be excluded by their statement identifier.
The include-all, specifies all control identified in the baseline are included in the scope if this assessment, as specified by the include-profile statement within the linked SSP.
Any control specified within exclude-controls must first be within a range of explicitly included controls, via include-controls or include-all.

define-assembly.name: control-objective-selection
define-assembly.description: Identifies the control objectives of the assessment. In the assessment plan, these are the planned objectives. In the assessment results, these are the assessed objectives, and reflects any changes from the plan.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this collection of control objectives.

define-assembly.name: include-all
define-assembly.description: A key word to indicate all.

remarks.p: Used to select a control objective for inclusion by the control objective's identifier.
Used to select a control objective for exclusion by the control objective's identifier.
The include-all field, specifies all control objectives for any in-scope control. In-scope controls are defined in the control-selection.
Any control objective specified within exclude-controls must first be within a range of explicitly included control objectives, via include-objectives or include-all.

In the context of an assessment plan, this construct is used to identify the controls and control objectives that are to be assessed. In the context of an assessment result, this construct is used to identify the actual controls and objectives that were assessed, reflecting any changes from the plan.
When resolving the selection of controls and control objectives, the following processing will occur:
1. Controls will be resolved by creating a set of controls based on the control-selections by first handling the includes, and then removing any excluded controls.

2. The set of control objectives will be resolved from the set of controls that was generated in the previous step. The set of control objectives is based on the control-objective-selection by first handling the includes, and then removing any excluded control objectives.

define-assembly.name: select-control-by-id
define-assembly.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

define-field.name: statement-id
define-field.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificity identified statements.

define-assembly.name: select-objective-by-id
define-assembly.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

define-assembly.name: assessment-subject-placeholder
define-assembly.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

define-assembly.name: source
define-assembly.description: Assessment subjects will be identified while conducting the referenced activity-instance.

define-flag.name: task-uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

define-assembly.name: assessment-subject
define-assembly.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out-of-scope.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

allowed-values.enum: The referenced assessment subject is a component defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a inventory item defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a location defined in the metadata of the SSP, Assessment Plan, or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a person or team to interview, who is defined as a party in the metadata of the SSP, Assessment Plan, or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a user defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of the collection of subjects being included in this assessment.

define-assembly.name: include-all
define-assembly.description: A key word to indicate all.

remarks.p: Processing of an include/exclude pair starts with processing the include, then removing matching entries in the exclude.

define-assembly.name: select-subject-by-id
define-assembly.description: Identifies a set of assessment subjects to include/exclude by UUID.

define-flag.name: subject-uuid
define-flag.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

define-flag.name: subject-type
define-flag.formal-name: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
define-flag.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref within a subject.

allowed-values.enum: Component
Inventory Item
Location
Interview Party
User
Resource or Artifact

define-assembly.name: subject-reference
define-assembly.description: A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

remarks.p: The subject reference UUID could point to an item defined in the SSP, AP, or AR.
Tools should check look for the ID in every file imported directly or indirectly.

define-assembly.name: assessment-assets
define-assembly.description: Identifies the assets used to perform this assessment, such as the assessment team, scanning tools, and assumptions.

remarks.p: Used to add any components for tools used during the assessment. These are represented here to avoid mixing with system components.

The technology tools used by the assessor to perform the assessment, such as vulnerability scanners. In the assessment plan these are the intended tools. In the assessment results, these are the actual tools used, including any differences from the assessment plan.

define-assembly.name: assessment-platform
define-assembly.description: Used to represent the toolset used to perform aspects of the assessment.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment Platform.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the assessment platform.

define-assembly.name: uses-component
define-assembly.description: The set of components that are used by the assessment platform.

define-flag.name: component-uuid
define-flag.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

remarks.p: Since responsible-party associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.
Since multiple assessment component entries can be provided, each component must have a unique uuid.

define-assembly.name: finding-target
define-assembly.description: Captures an assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Identifies the type of the target.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to a control statement identifier within a control.
A reference to a control objective identifier within a control.

remarks.p: The target will always be a reference to: 1) a control statement, or 2) a control objective. In the former case, there is always a single top-level statement within a control. Thus, if the entire control is targeted, this statement identifier can be used.

define-flag.name: target-id
define-flag.description: Identifies the specific target qualified by the type.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this objective status.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of the assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

define-assembly.name: status
define-assembly.description: A determination of if the objective is satisfied or not within a given system.

define-flag.name: state
define-flag.description: An indication as to whether the objective is satisfied or not.

allowed-values.enum: The objective has been completely satisfied.
The objective has not been completely satisfied, but may be partially satisfied.

define-flag.name: reason
define-flag.description: The reason the objective was given it's status.

allowed-values.enum: The target system or system component satisfied all the conditions.
The target system or system component did not satisfy all the conditions.
Some other event took place that is not a pass or a fail.

remarks.p: Reason may contain any value, and should be used to communicate additional information regarding the status.
The implementation-status is used to qualify the status value to indicate the degree to which the control was found to be implemented.

define-assembly.name: observation
define-assembly.description: Describes an individual observation.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this observation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given observation across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this observation.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this assessment observation.

define-field.name: method
define-field.description: Identifies how the observation was made.

allowed-values.enum: An inspection was performed.
An interview was performed.
A manual or automated test was performed.
This is only for use when converting historic content to OSCAL, where the conversion process cannot initially identify the appropriate method(s).

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: Identifies the nature of the observation. More than one may be used to further qualify and enable filtering.

allowed-values.enum: A difference between the SSP implementation statement, and actual implementation.
An observation about the status of a the associated control objective.
A mitigating factor was identified.
An assessment finding. Used for observations made by tools, penetration testing, and other means.
An observation from a past assessment, which was converted to OSCAL at a later date.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that gathered the evidence resulting in the observation identification.
Identifies who was interviewed, or what was tested or inspected.

define-assembly.name: relevant-evidence
define-assembly.description: Links this observation to relevant evidence.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: >A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.

remarks.p: The value of the href can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment that points to a back-matter resource in the same document.

If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified resource in the document's back-matter or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.

If an internet resource is used, the href value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document containing the link.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this evidence.

define-field.name: collected
define-field.description: Date/time stamp identifying when the finding information was collected.

define-field.name: expires
define-field.description: Date/time identifying when the finding information is out-of-date and no longer valid. Typically used with continuous assessment scenarios.

define-assembly.name: origin
define-assembly.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity.

define-assembly.name: origin-actor
define-assembly.description: The actor that produces an observation, a finding, or a risk. One or more actor type can be used to specify a person that is using a tool.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: The kind of actor.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to a tool component defined with the assessment assets.
A reference to an assessment-platform defined with the assessment assets.
A reference to a party defined within the document metadata.

define-flag.name: actor-uuid
define-flag.description: A pointer to the tool or person based on the associated type.

define-flag.name: role-id
define-flag.description: For a party, this can optionally be used to specify the role the actor was performing.

define-assembly.name: related-task
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual task for which the containing object is a consequence of.

define-flag.name: task-uuid
define-flag.description: References a unique task by UUID.

remarks.p: Identifies the person or organization responsible for performing a specific role defined by the activity.
The assessment subjects that the task was performed against.

define-assembly.name: identified-subject
define-assembly.description: Used to detail assessment subjects that were identfied by this task.

define-flag.name: subject-placeholder-uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier Reference
define-flag.description: References a unique assessment subject placeholder defined by this task.

remarks.p: The assessment subjects that the task identified, which will be used by another task through a subject-placeholder reference. Such a task will "consume" these subjects.
Since responsible-party associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-field.name: threat-id
define-field.description: A pointer, by ID, to an externally-defined threat.

define-flag.name: system
define-flag.description: Specifies the source of the threat information.

allowed-values.enum: The value conforms to FedRAMP definitions.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

define-assembly.name: risk
define-assembly.description: An identified risk.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this risk. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given risk across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this risk.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable summary of the identified risk, to include a statement of how the risk impacts the system.

define-field.name: statement
define-field.description: An summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

define-field.name: status
define-field.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been identified.
The identified risk is being investigated. (Open risk)
Remediation activities are underway, but are not yet complete. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been submitted for approval. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been approved. (Open risk)
The risk has been resolved.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that identified this risk.

define-assembly.name: mitigating-factor
define-assembly.description: Describes an existing mitigating factor that may affect the overall determination of the risk, with an optional link to an implementation statement in the SSP.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this mitigating factor. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given mitigating factor across revisions.

define-flag.name: implementation-uuid
define-flag.description: Points to an implementation statement in the SSP.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this mitigating factor.

remarks.p: Links identifiable elements of the system to this mitigating factor, such as an inventory-item or component.

define-field.name: deadline
define-field.description: The date/time by which the risk must be resolved.

define-assembly.name: risk-log
define-assembly.description: A log of all risk-related tasks taken.

define-assembly.name: entry
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual risk response that occurred as part of managing an identified risk.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Risk Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies a risk log entry. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this risk log entry.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of what was done regarding the risk.

define-field.name: start
define-field.description: Identifies the start date and time of the event.

define-field.name: end
define-field.description: Identifies the end date and time of the event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

remarks.p: Identifies a change in risk status made resulting from the task described by this risk log entry. This allows the risk's status history to be captured as a sequence of risk log entries.

define-assembly.name: related-response
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual risk response that this log entry is for.

define-flag.name: response-uuid
define-flag.description: References a unique risk response by UUID.

remarks.p: This is used to identify the task(s) that this log entry was generated for.

allowed-values.enum: The type of remediation tracking entry. Can be multi-valued.
Contacted vendor to determine the status of a pending fix to a known vulnerability.
Information related to the current state of response to this risk.
A significant step in the response plan has been achieved.
An activity was completed that reduces the likelihood or impact of this risk.
An activity was completed that eliminates the likelihood or impact of this risk.
The risk is no longer applicable to the system.
A deviation request was made to the authorizing official.
A previously submitted deviation request has been modified.
The authorizing official approved the deviation.
The authorizing official rejected the deviation.

define-assembly.name: related-observation
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: observation-uuid
define-flag.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been confirmed to be a false positive.
The risk has been accepted. No further action will be taken.
The risk has been adjusted.
A numeric value indicating the sequence in which risks should be addressed. (Lower numbers are higher priority)

define-assembly.name: logged-by
define-assembly.description: Used to indicate who created a log entry in what role.

define-flag.name: party-uuid
define-flag.description: A pointer to the party who is making the log entry.

define-flag.name: role-id
define-flag.description: A point to the role-id of the role in which the party is making the log entry.

define-field.name: risk-status
define-field.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been identified.
The identified risk is being investigated. (Open risk)
Remediation activities are underway, but are not yet complete. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been submitted for approval. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been approved. (Open risk)
The risk has been resolved.

define-assembly.name: characterization
define-assembly.description: A collection of descriptive data about the containing object from a specific origin.

remarks.p: metadata about the specific actor that generated this descriptive data.

define-assembly.name: facet
define-assembly.description: An individual characteristic that is part of a larger set produced by the same actor.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: The name of the risk metric within the specified system.

define-flag.name: system
define-flag.description: Specifies the naming system under which this risk metric is organized, which allows for the same names to be used in different systems controlled by different parties. This avoids the potential of a name clash.

allowed-values.enum: The facet is from an unknown taxonomy. The meaning of the name is tool or organization specific.

define-flag.name: value
define-flag.description: Indicates the value of the facet.

allowed-values.enum: Indicates if the facet is 'initial' as first identified, or 'adjusted' indicating that the value has be changed after some adjustments have been made (e.g., to identify residual risk).
As first identified.
Indicates that residual risk remains after some adjustments have been made.
General likelihood rating.
General impact rating.
General risk rating.
General severity rating.
Likelihood as defined by FedRAMP. The class can be used to specify 'initial' and 'adjusted' risk states.
Impact as defined by FedRAMP. The class can be used to specify 'initial' and 'adjusted' risk states.
Risk as calculated according to FedRAMP. The class can be used to specify 'initial' and 'adjusted' risk states.
An identifier managed by the CVE program (see https://cve.mitre.org/).

define-assembly.name: response
define-assembly.description: Describes either recommended or an actual plan for addressing the risk.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this remediation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given remediation across revisions.

define-flag.name: lifecycle
define-flag.description: Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.

allowed-values.enum: Recommended Remediation
The actions intended to resolve the risk.
This remediation activities were performed to address the risk.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this response activity.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this response plan.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that generated this recommended or planned response.

define-assembly.name: required-asset
define-assembly.description: Identifies an asset required to achieve remediation.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this required asset. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given required asset across revisions.

remarks.p: Identifies an asset associated with this requirement, such as a party, system component, or inventory-item.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this required asset.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this required asset.

allowed-values.enum: The UUID of the person or organization who made the recommendation
The UUID of the tool that made the recommendation
The risk will be eliminated.
The risk will be reduced.
The risk will be transferred to another organization or entity.
The risk will continue to exist without further efforts to address it. (Sometimes referred to as "Operationally required")
The risk will be partially transferred to another organization or entity.
Plans will be made to address the risk impact if the risk occurs. (This is a form of mitigation.)
No response, such as when the identified risk is found to be a false positive.

define-flag.name: objective-id
define-flag.description: Points to an assessment objective.

define-assembly.name: assessment-part
define-assembly.description: A partition of an assessment plan or results or a child of another part.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

allowed-values.enum: An assessment asset.
An assessment method.
Describes a set of control objectives.

define-flag.name: ns
define-flag.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

remarks.p: Provides a means to segment the value space for the name, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed names and associated text used in a part. This allows the semantics associated with a given name to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.
An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.
When a ns is not provided, its value should be assumed to be http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

define-flag.name: class
define-flag.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

remarks.p: A class can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific class value.
A class can also be used in an OSCAL profile as a means to target an alteration to control content.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

define-field.name: prose
define-field._in-xml-name: p ul ol pre table h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6
define-field.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

allowed-values.enum: The assessment method to use. This typically appears on parts with the name "assessment".
The process of holding discussions with individuals or groups of individuals within an organization to once again, facilitate assessor understanding, achieve clarification, or obtain evidence.
The process of reviewing, inspecting, observing, studying, or analyzing one or more assessment objects (i.e., specifications, mechanisms, or activities).
The process of exercising one or more assessment objects (i.e., activities or mechanisms) under specified conditions to compare actual with expected behavior.

remarks.p: A part provides for logical partitioning of prose, and can be thought of as a grouping structure (e.g., section). A part can have child parts allowing for arbitrary nesting of prose content (e.g., statement hierarchy). A part can contain prop objects that allow for enriching prose text with structured name/value information.

A part can be assigned an optional id, which allows for internal and external references to the textual concept contained within a part. A id provides a means for an OSCAL profile, or a higher layer OSCAL model to reference a specific part within a catalog. For example, an id can be used to reference or to make modifications to a control statement in a profile.

Use of part and prop provides for a wide degree of extensibility within the OSCAL catalog model. The optional ns provides a means to qualify a part's name, allowing for organization-specific vocabularies to be defined with clear semantics. Any organization that extends OSCAL in this way should consistently assign a ns value that represents the organization, making a given namespace qualified name unique to that organization. This allows the combination of ns and name to always be unique and unambiguous, even when mixed with extensions from other organizations. Each organization is responsible for governance of their own extensions, and is strongly encouraged to publish their extensions as standards to their user community. If no ns is provided, the name is expected to be in the "OSCAL" namespace.

To ensure a ns is unique to an organization and naming conflicts are avoided, a URI containing a DNS or other globally defined organization name should be used. For example, if FedRAMP and DoD both extend OSCAL, FedRAMP will use the ns "https://fedramp.gov", while DoD will use the ns "https://defense.gov" for any organization specific name.

Tools that process OSCAL content are not required to interpret unrecognized OSCAL extensions; however, OSCAL compliant tools should not modify or remove unrecognized extensions, unless there is a compelling reason to do so, such as data sensitivity.

define-assembly.name: assessment-results
define-assembly.description: Security assessment results, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor in the FedRAMP Security Assessment Report.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment results file. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the results changes.

remarks.p: Used by the SAR to import information about the original plan for assessing the system.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

define-assembly.name: result
define-assembly.description: Used by the assessment results and POA&M. In the assessment results, this identifies all of the assessment observations and findings, initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition. In the POA&M, this identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this set of results. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given set of results across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this set of results.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this set of test results.

define-field.name: start
define-field.description: Date/time stamp identifying the start of the evidence collection reflected in these results.

define-field.name: end
define-field.description: Date/time stamp identifying the end of the evidence collection reflected in these results. In a continuous motoring scenario, this may contain the same value as start if appropriate.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

remarks.p: Used to add any components, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any inventory-items, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any users, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)

This needs to be defined in the results if an assessment platform used is different from the one described in the assessment plan. Else the platform(s) defined in the plan may be referenced within the results.
Since multiple component entries can be provided, each component must have a unique uuid.
A given uuid must be assigned only once to a user.
The Assessment Results control-selection ignores any control selection in the Assessment Plan and re-selects controls from the baseline identified by the SSP.
The Assessment Results control-objective-selection ignores any control objective selection in the Assessment Plan and re-selects control objectives from the baseline identified by the SSP.

Any additional control objectives defined in the Assessment Plan local-definitions do not need to be re-defined in the Assessment Results local-definitions; however, if they were explicitly referenced with an Assessment Plan control-objective-selection, they need to be selected again in the Assessment Results control-objective-selection.

define-assembly.name: attestation
define-assembly.description: A set of textual statements, typically written by the assessor.

remarks.p: Since responsible-party associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: assessment-log
define-assembly.description: A log of all assessment-related actions taken.

define-assembly.name: entry
define-assembly.description: Identifies the result of an action and/or task that occurred as part of executing an assessment plan or an assessment event that occurred in producing the assessment results.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Assessment Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this event.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this event.

define-field.name: start
define-field.description: Identifies the start date and time of an event.

define-field.name: end
define-field.description: Identifies the end date and time of an event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

define-assembly.name: finding
define-assembly.description: Describes an individual finding.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this finding. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistently used for a given finding across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this finding.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this finding.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool generated this finding.

define-field.name: implementation-statement-uuid
define-field.description: Identifies the implementation statement in the SSP to which this finding is related.

define-assembly.name: related-observation
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: observation-uuid
define-flag.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

define-assembly.name: associated-risk
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: risk-uuid
define-flag.description: References an risk defined in the list of risks.

define-assembly.name: import-ap
define-assembly.description: Used by assessment-results to import information about the original plan for assessing the system.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: >A resolvable URL reference to the assessment plan governing the assessment activities.

remarks.p: The value of the href can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment that points to a back-matter resource in the same document.

If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified resource in the document's back-matter or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.

If an internet resource is used, the href value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document containing the link.

define-assembly.name: plan-of-action-and-milestones
define-assembly.description: A plan of action and milestones which identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition, such as those required by FedRAMP.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this POA&M. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the POA&M changes.

remarks.p: Used by the POA&M to import information about the system.
Either an OSCAL-based SSP must be imported, or a unique system-id must be specified. Both may be present.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Allows components, and inventory-items to be defined within the POA&M for circumstances where no OSCAL-based SSP exists, or is not delivered with the POA&M.

remarks.p: Used to add any components, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any inventory-items, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Since multiple component entries can be provided, each component must have a unique uuid.

define-assembly.name: poam-item
define-assembly.description: Describes an individual POA&M item.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies the POA&M entry. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when referring to this information. A UUID should be consistently used for a given POA&M item across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for this POA&M item .

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of POA&M item.

define-assembly.name: origin
define-assembly.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool or person.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool generated this poam-item.

define-assembly.name: related-observation
define-assembly.description: Relates the poam-item to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: observation-uuid
define-flag.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

define-assembly.name: associated-risk
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: risk-uuid
define-flag.description: References an risk defined in the list of risks.
